ws.rocket.path.meta

Interface View


  • public interface View
    Contract for objects capable of returning an HTTP response. There may be created views for HTML, XML, JSON, redirect, etc response.

    There is an order in which the view methods are called:

    1. attr(String, Object) may be called any number of times to set view data;
    2. setNodes(TreeNode, TreeNode) is called once to provide the tree nodes, which can be used at rendering;
    3. writeHeaders(HttpServletResponse) is called once for outputing HTTP status and headers;
    4. writeContent(HttpServletRequest, HttpServletResponse) may be called once (except for HTTP HEAD request) for outputing HTTP response body.

    Implementations should also pay attention to caching (see package ws.rocket.path.meta.http.cache).

    To better facilitate all possible view implementations, library users should introduce a ViewFactory for their application that request handlers could use.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      View attr(java.lang.String key, java.lang.Object value)
      Associates a new request attribute with the view.
      void setNodes(TreeNode root, TreeNode node)
      Provides the tree root node and the current node for which the view is being rendered.
      void writeContent(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      Triggers the view object to write HTTP message content (entity) to the provided response wrapper.
      void writeHeaders(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      Triggers the view object to write any HTTP headers to the provided response wrapper.

    • Method Detail

      • attr

        View attr(java.lang.String key,
        java.lang.Object value)
        Associates a new request attribute with the view. When the view is rendered, the attribute value can be used.

        Depending on the view type, a view does not have to provide functionality for this method. However, when implemented, the view must not expect to have a request object available at the time this method is called.

        Parameters:
        key - The key for the request attribute.
        value - The value for the request attribute.
        Returns:
        The current instance of the view.

      • setNodes

        void setNodes(TreeNode root,
            TreeNode node)
        Provides the tree root node and the current node for which the view is being rendered. This method is called by request handler before any of the write*() methods is called. Tree node components should not call this method.
        Parameters:
        root - The root node of the tree (always present).
        node - The requested node to be rendered (can be null in some cases).

      • writeHeaders

        void writeHeaders(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        Triggers the view object to write any HTTP headers to the provided response wrapper. At the time this method is called, setNodes(TreeNode, TreeNode) is already called.
        Parameters:
        response - The response wrapper.

      • writeContent

        void writeContent(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
                  throws java.io.IOException,
                         javax.servlet.ServletException
        Triggers the view object to write HTTP message content (entity) to the provided response wrapper. At the time this method is called, setNodes(TreeNode, TreeNode) is already called.
        Parameters:
        request - The incoming request object.
        response - The response wrapper.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an input or output exception occurs.
        javax.servlet.ServletException - If an exception occurs that interferes with the servlet's normal operation.
